string-array.name: quotes
string-array.item: Details matter, it\'s worth waiting to get it right\n- Steve Jobs
Have the courage to follow your heart and intuition. They somehow already know what you truly want to become.\n- Steve Jobs
Your time is limited, so don’t waste it living someone else’s life.\n- Steve Jobs
Your \'I can\' is more important than your IQ\n- Robin Sharma
Success is getting what you want. Happiness is wanting what you get.\n- Dale Carnegie
If you want to conquer fear, don\'t sit home and think about it. Go out and get busy.\n- Dale Carnegie
People rarely succeed unless they have fun in what they are doing.\n- Dale Carnegie
It does not matter how slowly you go so long as you do not stop.\n- Confucius
The biggest risk is to take no risk at all.\n- Casey Neistat
Don’t try to fit in—you will be unhappy when you try to be something you are not.\n- Casey Neistat
Open your eyes, look within. Are you satisfied with the life you\’re living?\n- Bob Marley
Good artists copy, great artists steal.\n- Steve Jobs
Life is really simple, but we insist on making it complicated.\n- Confucius
Your thoughts become things!\n- Rhonda Byrne
Everything is created twice, first in the mind and then in reality.\n- Robin Sharma
When there is no desire, all things are at peace. \n- Laozi
Simplicity is the ultimate sophistication. \n- Leonardo da Vinci
Simplicity is the essence of happiness. \n- Cedric Bledsoe
Smile, breathe, and go slowly. \n- Thich Nhat Hanh
Simplicity is an acquired taste. \n-Katharine Gerould
Well begun is half done. \n-Aristotle
He who is contented is rich. \n-Laozi
Very little is needed to make a happy life. \n-Marcus Antoninus
It is quality rather than quantity that matters. \n-Lucius Annaeus Seneca
Genius is one percent inspiration and ninety-nine percent perspiration. \n-Thomas Edison
Computer science is no more about computers than astronomy is about telescopes. \n-Edsger Dijkstra
